citation:Producer.producer:Name: Preconception and Pregnancy in Inflammatory Bowel Disease Clinical Research Program

citation:Description.dsDescription:Text: The objective of this study was to evaluate whether a FCP measurement in the 2nd or 3rd trimester of pregnancy in women with IBD can predict preterm delivery.

Grant Information.grantNumber:Grant Agency: Alberta Innovates - Health Solutions (AIHS); Centre of Excellence for Gastrointestinal Inflammation and Immunity Research (CEGIIR)

Related Datasets: Effects of Maternal IBD and IBD Breast Milk on Neonatal Gut Microbiome and Intestinal Inflammation
ore:describes.socialscience:Universe: Adult women with IBD enrolled in the Preconception and Pregnancy in IBD clinic and healthy volunteers.
ore:describes.Subject: Medicine, Health and Life Sciences
ore:describes.Title: Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD
ore:describes.socialscience:Sampling Procedure: 25 study participants were recruited through convenience sample.
ore:describes.citation:Characteristic of Sources Noted: Clinical disease activity scores (modified Harvey Bradshaw Index (mHBI) for Crohn's disease and partial Mayo (pMayo) for ulcerative colitis) were obtained at each study visit. C-reactive protein and Fecal calprotectin were analysed: patients collected a first morning stool sample, which was analyzed for FCP using the Quantum Blue high range reader. Delivery outcomes (preterm (less than 37 weeks) and full term (37 or more weeks) and delivery method) were also obtained after birth.
ore:describes.socialscience:Collection Mode: Self-administered questionnaire: Paper; Physical measurements and tests
ore:describes.socialscience:Frequency: Data was collected at each clinical visit.
ore:describes.schema:name: Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy Predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD
ore:describes.dvcore:conditions: Access to deidentified data may be permitted for external researchers, with limitations. Only researchers with REB-approved projects may be permitted access to the deidentified data. A basic data sharing agreement form is required (ie. Agree to not attempt to re-identify the records so as to relate the information on the file to a particular person). The data producer determines access on a case-by-case basis. Contact the data producer directly to discuss terms and conditions of access.
ore:describes.schema:includedInDataCatalog: Women and Children's Health Research Institute (WCHRI)

ore:aggregates.schema:description: "Elevated Fecal Calprotectin in the Second or Third Trimester of Pregnancy predicts Preterm Delivery in Women with IBD" poster presentation. The presentation contains aggregate data tables.
